page.title: 11Industry page 2
page.content:
Between 1860 and 1880 the population of Burham and Halling almost doubled and that of Snodland and Wouldham trebled because of the rapid growth of the cement industry. Barges on the River Medway were used to transport the cement.However,the cement factories on the River Thames could be reached by much larger ships. Factories began to close along the Medway during the 1920's especially those on the eastern side.Rugby Cement in Halling and,until recently,Blue Circle in Holborough developed the use of road transport.
Other smaller industries in the area include a building firm,a small electronics firm,iron and metal works, printing workshops and a woodyard.
